page.title: 01GLUSBURN MOOR
page.content: This D-block is mainly rural,the land being used for grazing or hay and silage.The villages of Cononley, Lothersdale and Cowling are on the edge of the block. Surgill Beck runs through the area which is quite hilly, comprising Cononley Moor, Glusburn Moor and Cowling Hill.The area is served by the A6068 Colne-Keighley road and the Leeds-Carlisle railway.The Pennine Way runs through Lothersdale. Evidence of previous industry are Cononley leadmines,disused textile mills and an earthworks.There is little present industry so it is necessary for people to commute to Keighley or Skipton.Each village has a few shops of its own but the nearest main shopping centres are Keighley, Skipton or Colne.
